fancymenu.actions.async.cant_run_async:
§x§lFailed to execute FancyMenu action!§r

You tried to asynchronously execute an action that only works on the game thread.
The action is probably part of a Ticker element that runs in Async mode.

§lAction Name: §x%s
fancymenu.actions.audio.next_track.desc: Skips to the next track in an Audio element's playlist.
fancymenu.actions.audio.next_track.value: The identifier of the Audio element to control
fancymenu.actions.audio.previous_track.d: Returns to the previous track in an Audio element's playlist.
fancymenu.actions.audio.previous_track.v: The identifier of the Audio element to control
fancymenu.actions.audio.set_audio_elemen:
Sets the volume of an Audio element by its identifier.
The volume is a value between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
fancymenu.actions.audio.toggle_play.desc:
Toggles between playing and pausing an Audio element.
If paused, resumes playback. If playing, pauses playback.
fancymenu.actions.audio.toggle_play.valu: The identifier of the audio element to control
fancymenu.actions.back_to_last_screen.de: Opens the last screen that was open before the current one.
fancymenu.actions.blocks.add.delay.desc:
Adds a Delay block that waits for the specified time before running its contained actions.

The rest of the script keeps running while the delay counts down.
Delay time is in milliseconds.

Keep in mind the delay resets when the screen gets re-initialized (for example after resizing the window or closing and reopening the screen).

This is useful for timed sequences, cooldowns or spacing actions.
fancymenu.actions.close_screen.desc:
Closes the active screen.
Opens the title screen if not in a world.
fancymenu.actions.copy_file.desc:
This action copies a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the source path to copy every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and requires the destination to be a directory.
fancymenu.actions.create_file.desc:
This action creates a new empty file in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. The file will only be created if it doesn't already exist. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.actions.delete_file.desc:
This action deletes a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the target path to delete every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and leaves the folder itself intact.
fancymenu.actions.disable_element_animat: Disables the Element Animator and stops its animation for all assigned targets.
fancymenu.actions.disable_layout.desc: Disable a layout by its name.
fancymenu.actions.disconnect.desc:
Leave a world or server
and set a screen to open after.
fancymenu.actions.display_in_chat_client: Prints text directly to your local chat without contacting the server. Supports formatting codes using the '&' prefix and serialized JSON text components.
Chat Message [Plain Text or Serialized JSON Component]
fancymenu.actions.download_file.desc:
This action downloads a file from a URL and saves it to the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

Provide the download folder instead of a file name; FancyMenu derives the saved file name from the HTTP response headers or the URL automatically.

§lAsynchronous Download:§r This action downloads files asynchronously, which means the download happens in the background without freezing or blocking the game. The game will continue running normally while the file is being downloaded.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
Allows you to edit Minecraft's config options.
fancymenu.actions.enable_element_animato: Enables the Element Animator and restarts its animation playback for all assigned targets.
fancymenu.actions.enable_layout.desc: Enable a layout by its name.
fancymenu.actions.errors.cannot_join_wor:
§x§lJoining World or Server Failed!§r

You tried to join a world or server while you're already in a world or on a server, which is not possible.

§lYou need to leave the current world or server first.
fancymenu.actions.execute_command_as_int:
Executes a command in singleplayer as the integrated server, ignoring permissions and the cheats setting.
Does nothing on multiplayer or when the world is opened to LAN.
fancymenu.actions.extract_zip_file: Extract ZIP File In Game Directory
fancymenu.actions.extract_zip_file.desc:
This action extracts a ZIP file into a folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. The target path includes the folder name the ZIP content gets extracted to, and no extra folders get created named like the ZIP file.

This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

This action extracts asynchronously and triggers the 'On ZIP Extracted via Action' listener when finished.
fancymenu.actions.generic.async_error: The '%s' action can't get executed asynchronously!
fancymenu.actions.manage_resource_pack.d:
Enable, disable, or toggle a resource pack by matching its display name.
Optionally skip the automatic reload when you want to trigger it later.
fancymenu.actions.manage_resource_pack.e: Choose whether this action enables, disables, or toggles the selected pack.
Enter the display name exactly as shown in the Resource Packs screen. Placeholders are supported.
Toggle whether FancyMenu should call the resource reload immediately after the selection changes.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_button.error:
Failed to mimic the click action of a button!
This probably means the button's parent screen is not supported.
Most unsupported screens are non-Vanilla screens from other mods.
If the screen is a §zVanilla screen§r, please §zreport§r this bug via GitHub.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.desc: Runs the selected Minecraft keybind as though it was pressed. Combine with placeholders to trigger controls remotely.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.edit.kee: Hold the key for the specified duration by repeatedly re-triggering it if necessary.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.edit.pre: When Keep Pressed is enabled, the key stays down for this many milliseconds before being released.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.error: FancyMenu could not find the requested keybind. Double-check the identifier and try again.
fancymenu.actions.mimicbutton.desc:
Mimic the click action of a Vanilla or mod button.

You need the §lwidget locator §rof
the button you want to mimic.

To get the widget locator, right-click
the button in the editor or enable
the Debug Overlay when not in the editor
then right-click the button.
fancymenu.actions.move_file.desc:
This action moves a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the source path to move every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and requires the destination to be a directory.
fancymenu.actions.multiselect.warning.ov:
§x§lOverride Action Scripts?

The selected entries have different action scripts!
All of their action scripts will get §xoverridden§r!

Continue?
fancymenu.actions.open_action_chooser.de: Opens the full Action Chooser screen with search bar for finding actions more easily.
fancymenu.actions.open_file_folder.desc:
This action opens a file or folder on your system with the default program for that file type. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory, for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.actions.open_screen.error:
Failed to open screen via the 'Open Screen or Custom GUI' action!
In most cases this means the screen is not supported by FancyMenu.
If the screen is a §zVanilla screen§r, please §zreport§r this bug via GitHub.
fancymenu.actions.opengui.desc:
Opens a screen by its identifier.

Supports vanilla/mod screens and
custom GUIs made with FancyMenu.
fancymenu.actions.openlink.desc: Open a link in your default browser.
fancymenu.actions.paste_to_chat.append.d:
If the action should append the text to existing
text that is already typed in the input field.
The action will override existing text if this is disabled.
fancymenu.actions.paste_to_chat.desc: Paste text to the chat input field.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.desc: Plays an audio resource once. Supports picking a sound channel and a base volume.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.edit.audio_: The audio resource source to play. Supports resource locations, local files, web URLs and placeholders.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.edit.base_v: A multiplier for the audio volume. 100% means full volume.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.edit.choose: Opens a file chooser for FancyMenu audio resources.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.edit.sound_: Which Minecraft sound category should be used for playback.
fancymenu.actions.play_audio.edit.title: Configure Play Audio
fancymenu.actions.print_to_log.desc: This action will print text to the game's log/console for debugging.
This action reloads resource packs just like when pressing F3 + T.

This action can only execute once every 5 seconds to prevent your Minecraft from exploding.
fancymenu.actions.reloadmenu.desc:
Reloads FancyMenu, including stuff like
panoramas, slideshows, etc.
fancymenu.actions.rename_file.desc:
This action renames a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Renaming a folder keeps its contents intact while updating its name.
fancymenu.actions.reset_element_animator: Resets the selected Element Animator and restarts its animation playback for all linked targets.
fancymenu.actions.screens.build_screen.e:
§zThis action has no value.
§zYou don't need to set one.
Edit the value of this action.
fancymenu.actions.screens.build_screen.f: §xYou need to edit the action value first!
fancymenu.actions.screens.move_action_do:
Moves the selected entry down in the
list, so it gets executed later.
This is more precise than using
drag-&-drop to move entries.
fancymenu.actions.screens.move_action_up:
Moves the selected entry up in the
list, so it gets executed earlier.
This is more precise than using
drag-&-drop to move entries.
fancymenu.actions.script_editor.cancel_w:
Do you really want to §xcancel§r the script editing?
§xThis will undo everything you've done in here!
fancymenu.actions.select_file.desc:
This action opens a native file selection dialog so you can pick a file from anywhere on your computer.
When a file is selected it gets copied to the configured target path inside the Minecraft instance directory (or the default '.minecraft' directory when the prefix is used).

FancyMenu also fires a listener with the selection result so you can trigger follow-up actions when the file was copied, the dialog was cancelled, or an error occurred.
fancymenu.actions.select_file.edit.exten:
Extensions that should be selectable in the file dialog.

Separate multiple entries with ',' or ';'.

Use values like 'png', 'jpg' or custom patterns such as '*.zip'.

Leave empty to allow every file.
fancymenu.actions.select_file.edit.filte:
The label shown in the native file dialog for the custom file filter.

Leave empty to use the default label.
fancymenu.actions.select_file.edit.overw: Choose whether FancyMenu should replace an existing file at the target path or cancel the action instead.
fancymenu.actions.select_file.edit.targe:
The destination that the selected file should be copied to.

Starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory.

Use '.minecraft/' as prefix to target the default .minecraft directory.
fancymenu.actions.send_http_request.desc:
Sends an HTTP request to a web target with configurable parameters.

This action allows you to send data to REST APIs, webhooks, or any HTTP endpoint.
Supports various authentication methods, custom headers, and different request types.
fancymenu.actions.send_http_request.edit:
The name of a FancyMenu variable the response should get written to.

§xIt's important to note that this action gets executed asynchronously,
§xso the variable value is not updated yet right after the action got executed.
Store Response as Single-Line in Variable: %s
fancymenu.actions.sendmessage.desc: Send a chat message or command.
fancymenu.actions.set_text_input_field_v:
Sets the value of an input field (text box) by its element identifier.
Works for custom and Vanilla elements.
Does nothing if the element was not found or is not an input field.
The element identifier of the target element.
If enabled, the value will also be set when the input field is inactive.

The value that should be set on the target input field.
Placeholders are supported.
Configure Set Text Input Field Value Action
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.desc: Displays a configurable toast notification. Supports custom width, icon, background texture, message and duration.
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.choose: Toast backgrounds should be 32 pixels tall and match the toast width.
Toast icons look best at 20x20 pixels.
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.clear_: Removes the custom background and falls back to Mojang's default toast sprite.
Removes the custom icon and uses an empty icon slot.
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.durati: How long the toast remains visible. Measured in milliseconds.
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.messag: Supports plain text (with § formatting codes) or a serialized JSON text component.
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.title: Configure Toast
fancymenu.actions.show_toast.edit.title_: Supports plain text (with § formatting codes) or a serialized JSON text component.
The toast width in pixels. Values outside the default range may stretch the background.
fancymenu.actions.stop_all_action_audios:
Stops all audios that are currently playing and were started via the "Play Audio" action.
This does not affect any other FancyMenu audio features such as button click sounds, Audio elements, menu open/close audios, etc.
fancymenu.actions.toggle_element_animato: Toggles whether the Element Animator plays its animation for linked targets. The state persists across sessions.
fancymenu.actions.toggle_layout.desc: Toggle a layout (Enable/Disable) by its name.
fancymenu.actions.update_screen.desc:
Updates the current screen.
This is useful if you need to rebuild its
elements (like images, custom buttons, etc.),
or after changing the GUI scale or other
options that need the screen to get updated.
It's basically the same as resizing the window.
fancymenu.actions.variables.clearall.des: Clears ALL of FancyMenu's stored variables.
fancymenu.actions.variables.set.desc:
Store text content in a variable to use it
in placeholders, requirements and more.
fancymenu.actions.video.background.toggl:
Toggles the paused state of a Video menu background by its identifier.

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.
fancymenu.actions.video.set_video_backgr:
Sets the volume of a Video menu background by its identifier.
The volume has to be a valid decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.
Video Background Identifier + Volume [ Separated by : ]
fancymenu.actions.video.set_video_elemen:
Sets the volume of a Video element.
The volume has to be a valid decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
Video Element Identifier + Volume [ Separated by : ]
fancymenu.actions.video.toggle_paused_st: Toggles the paused state of a Video element.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.desc:
This action writes content to a file in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.conten:
The content to write to the file.
Use '\n' to represent line breaks. Click the edit button for multi-line editing.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.mode.d: Choose whether to override the entire file content or append to the existing content.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.target:
The path to the file to write to.
Starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory.
Use '.minecraft/' prefix to access the default .minecraft directory.
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.configure.in:
When ENABLED, the parallax effect will move in the SAME direction
as the mouse, otherwise it moves in the opposite direction.
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.configure.no: §xYou need to choose an image or set an image URL first!
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.configure.pa:
The horizontal intensity of the parallax effect.
Needs to be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement).

The vertical intensity of the parallax effect.
Needs to be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement).
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.configure.sl: Slide Wide Images From Left To Right: %s
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.desc:
Well, it's an image.
Works with JPEG, PNG, APNG, GIF and FMA (FancyMenu Animation).
Supports local and web images.
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.restart_anim: Restart Animated Textures When Opening Screen: %s
fancymenu.backgrounds.image.type.web.fal:
Set an (optional) fallback image that gets
displayed in case the main image fails to load.
fancymenu.backgrounds.panorama.desc:
A moving panorama cube.
Similar to the Title Screen background.
See docs.fancymenu.net for details.
fancymenu.backgrounds.slideshow.desc:
An image slideshow.
See docs.fancymenu.net for details.
fancymenu.backgrounds.video_mcef.configu: §xYou need to choose a video first!
fancymenu.backgrounds.video_mcef.desc:
Plays a video file as menu background.
§xThis background needs the MCEF mod to work!
fancymenu.commands.closeguiscreen.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to close GUI screen via /closeguiscreen command!
fancymenu.commands.openguiscreen.error: [FANCYMENU] An error happened while trying to open a GUI via the /openguiscreen command!
fancymenu.commands.variable.get.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to get variable via /fmvariable command!
fancymenu.commands.variable.set.error: [FANCYMENU] Failed to set variable via /fmvariable command!

fancymenu.commmands.layout.unable_to_set: [FANCYMENU] Unable to set layout state of '%s'! Layout not found!
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.identifier.a: Identifier already in use! Identifiers need to be unique!
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.popup_mode.d: If the Custom GUI should work like a popup menu that gets opened on top of the parent screen.
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.popup_mode_b: If there should be an overlay rendered over the screen in the background of the popup menu.
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.title: Screen Title (Optional):
fancymenu.custom_guis.build.world_backgr: If the vanilla background blur/tint should be rendered while showing the world behind the GUI.
fancymenu.custom_guis.manage.remove.conf:
Do you really want to §xdelete§r the selected GUI?
§xThis action cannot be undone!
Remove override rules for Vanilla/mod screens.

Do you really want to §xdelete§r the override rule?
§xThis action cannot be undone!
fancymenu.custom_guis.override.confirm:
Overriding screens can cause §xunexpected game behavior§r.
Do you really want to §xoverride§r the screen now?
fancymenu.customization.scroll_lists.des:
Some screens have headers and footers.
For the most part these screens are
scrollable screens like the Singleplayer Screen,
but also some newer screens like the new
Create World Screen has a header for its tabs.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.a: Controls how often bursts spawn. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.c: The confetti color, as HEX color, starting with #.
If confetti should use random colorful colors instead of a single color.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.d: Controls how many particles spawn per burst. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.f: Controls how fast confetti falls. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.m: If confetti should burst from the mouse cursor when clicking instead of spawning randomly.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.p: Limits how many confetti particles can land.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.confetti.s: Scales confetti particles. Needs to be a value between 0.25 and 5.0.
The color of the fireflies, as HEX color, starting with #.
If firefly groups should follow the mouse when nearby.
Controls how many groups spawn. Needs to be a value between 0.1 and 4.0.
Scales the radius of each group (how spread out they are). Needs to be a value between 0.5 and 2.0.
Controls how many fireflies appear per group. Needs to be a value between 0.1 and 4.0.
If fireflies should occasionally land on surfaces and buttons.
Scales firefly size. Needs to be a value between 1.0 and 4.0.
Controls how many explosions spawn. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
Scales how large the explosions appear. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
Scales the overall fireworks overlay. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
If the rockets should be visible while flying up before they explode.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.leaves.col: The second leaf color, as HEX color, starting with #.
The first leaf color, as HEX color, starting with #.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.leaves.den: Controls how many leaves appear. Needs to be a value between 0.0 and 2.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.leaves.fal: Controls how fast leaves fall. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.leaves.sca: Scales leaves and wind animation. Needs to be a value between 1.0 and 5.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.leaves.win: Controls base drift, gust strength, and gust frequency. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.
Toggles the strong wind blows that push leaves around.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.color: The color of the rain, as HEX color, starting with #.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.drips: If drips should appear below surfaces and buttons.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.inten: The intensity of the rainfall. Needs to be a value between 0.0 and 2.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.puddl: If puddles should appear when raindrops hit surfaces.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.scale: Scales raindrop length. Needs to be a value between 1.0 and 3.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.rain.thund:
If rain should occasionally flash like thunder.

§zWARNING: This makes the screen flash! Do not use this if you react sensitive to flashing lights!
Scales the brightness of thunder flashes. Needs to be a value between 0.1 and 2.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.snow.accum: If snow should slowly build up at the bottom of the screen and on buttons.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.snow.color: The color of the snow, as HEX color, starting with #.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.snow.inten: The intensity of the snowfall. Needs to be a value between 0.0 and 2.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.snow.scale: Scales snowflake size. Needs to be a value between 1.0 and 6.0.
fancymenu.decoration_overlays.snow.speed: Controls how fast the snow falls. Needs to be a value between 0.01 and 5.0.

fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.change_a:
If the anchor of elements should get changed when
hovering over anchor areas (the rectangles in all edges).

You need to drag elements to change their anchors on hover.

If the anchor of elements should get changed to the
"Other Element" anchor when hovering over other elements.

You need to drag elements to change their anchors on hover.
fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.charging:
How long you need to hover an anchor area/element
to change the anchor point of an element.
fancymenu.editor.anchor_overlay.invert_c:
Inverts the colors of what's behind the overlay,
so the overlay is always visible.

Enabling this disables custom colors and opacity.
fancymenu.editor.auto_scaling.disable_fo:
§xYou need to disable §lauto-scaling §r§xfirst
§xbefore editing the forced GUI scale.
fancymenu.editor.background.blur_backgro:
If Vanilla's background blur should get
applied to the custom background.
fancymenu.editor.background.show_overlay: Show Dark Overlay On Custom Background: %s

If the dark overlay rendered by Vanilla Minecraft
should be visible on custom backgrounds.
fancymenu.editor.background_options.copy:
This will copy the identifier of the
current menu background to the clipboard.

The background identifier is used by actions, placeholders
and similar stuff to communicate with the background instance.
fancymenu.editor.buddy.enable.desc:
If a cute little pet creature should
walk around at the bottom of the editor screen.
fancymenu.editor.close_audio.desc: Play an audio when closing the screen.
fancymenu.editor.decoration_overlays.des: Decoration overlays are fullscreen overlays that show in front of all elements and are not interactable most of the time.
fancymenu.editor.layout.index.desc:
The layout index is useful when you have
multiple layouts active for the same screen.
If these layouts need to get loaded
in a specific order, use the layout index.
The bigger the index, the later the layout
gets loaded, which means it is ON TOP OF
layouts with a smaller index.

For example: A layout with index 1 will
be under a layout with index 2.
fancymenu.editor.object.movedown.desc:
Moves the element one layer down.

§x§lIMPORTANT:
Selected elements are always on top,
so you will not see the change
until you deselect the element.
fancymenu.editor.object.moveup.desc:
Moves the element one layer up.

§x§lIMPORTANT:
Selected elements are always on top,
so you will not see the change
until you deselect the element.
fancymenu.editor.open_audio.desc: Play an audio when opening the screen.
fancymenu.editor.render_custom_behind_va:
If all non-vanilla elements should
get rendered behind vanilla elements.

Since you can't change the order
of vanilla elements, this is the only
way to have some kind of control over it.
fancymenu.editor.rightclick.scale.invali: Scale values can't be smaller than 0!
fancymenu.editor.saving_failed.generic: An error happened while trying to save the layout!
fancymenu.editor.settings.enable_element:
If elements should show controls for tilting them.
You can also set their vertical/horizontal tilt in their right-click menu.
fancymenu.editor.settings.enable_rotatio:
If elements should show controls for rotating them.
You can also set their rotation in their right-click menu.
fancymenu.editor.text_editor.single_line:
The target needs a single-line text, which means all lines will
get merged into one line and all leading spaces of all lines
except the very first line will get removed in the actual
output text for the target.
fancymenu.editor.warning.unsaved:
You have §xunsaved§r changes!
All unsaved changes for the current layout will get §xlost§r!
fancymenu.element.auto_sizing.desc:
Auto-sizing will try to adjust the element's size
based on the screen size, so it's never too big or
too small for the current screen size.

It is not recommended to use this when
§lauto-scaling §ris enabled in the layout.
fancymenu.element.base_opacity.desc: Should be a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0.
fancymenu.element.elements.splash_text.d:
A splash text like the bouncing
text in the Title screen.
fancymenu.element.fading.error.negative_:
Fading speed needs to be a positive and
valid floating point value (bigger than 0.0).
fancymenu.element.fading.fade_out.desc:
Fade-Out will NOT fade-out elements before opening a new menu!
It is meant to be used when elements change
their visibility via loading requirements.
fancymenu.element.general.pick_element.d:
List will all elements at the position
of the mouse cursor when
you opened this context menu.

Useful for when you need to
select an element that's behind
another one.
fancymenu.element.rotation.advanced_mode:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
rotation degrees value, but it will also disable rotation grabbers.
fancymenu.element.rotation.degrees.desc:
Set the rotation angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values rotate clockwise.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.element.sticky_anchor.desc:
In this mode, the element's position will get calculated
in a different way than normal.

This mode makes the element always keep the exact same distance
to its anchor, no matter the current size of the element.
This means the size of the element can dynamically change
without it moving away or getting closer to its anchor.
While this can be useful in some situations, there
are also cases where this behaviour is not optimal.

§xThis has NO EFFECT when using another element as anchor!
fancymenu.element.sticky_anchor.desc.dis: §xYou need to disable 'Stay on Screen' first to use this!
fancymenu.element.tilt.horizontal.advanc:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
horizontal tilt degrees value, but it will also disable tilt grabbers.
fancymenu.element.tilt.horizontal.degree:
Set the horizontal tilt angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values tilt the right side away from the viewer.
Range: -60 to 60 degrees.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.element.tilt.vertical.advanced:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
vertical tilt degrees value, but it will also disable tilt grabbers.
Set the vertical tilt angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values tilt the top away from the viewer.
Range: -60 to 60 degrees.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.elements.abstract.should_be_af: Should Be Affected By Decoration Overlays: %s
fancymenu.elements.anchor_points.desc:
Sets the origin point from
where this element's position
should get calculated.

§zYou can see how an element
§zis affected by its anchor point
§zwhen you resize the editor window.
fancymenu.elements.anchor_points.element:
Set the position of another element as
anchor point, so this element
will always move with the other one.

§xYou need the element ID
§xof the parent element here.
§xYou can get the element ID by
§xright-clicking the parent element.

Invalid Element ID!

No element found with the given ID!
This element lets you animate other elements by using keyframes!
It allows you to smoothly change the size and position of elements.

If enabled, the Animator will not apply
the position of keyframes to the target elements.

If enabled, the Animator will not apply
the size of keyframes to the target elements.

§lSelected Keyframe:
Time: %s
Position: (%s, %s)
Size: %sx%s
Anchor: %s
Sticky: %s

When enabled, the arrow keys will move the
preview element instead of the selected keyframe.

In offset mode, the target elements will use their
normal position as origin and get animated starting from this
position instead of getting their position completely overridden.

In this mode, keyframes get saved in a different way.
The middle of the screen (crosshair) stands for
the target element and you should record keyframes
around this crosshair.
Keyframes recorded in offset mode are not compatible
with the normal mode an vice-versa, so you should
choose a mode before start recording.
Set the recording speed to 0% to manually move the progress bar!
Set the recording speed to 0% to edit keyframes!

Lets you set the same distance between
keyframes for all selected keyframes.
Lets you edit the timestamp of the selected keyframe.
Edit, add, or remove animation keyframes.
This element is already a target!
Add or remove elements that should be animated by the Element Animator.
Select elements that should be animated by the Element Animator.
When enabled, each target gets an additional random timing offset within the configured range.
Configure the minimum and maximum random timing offset in milliseconds.
fancymenu.elements.audio.desc:
Audio elements allow you to play
audio files in screens.
Supports multiple audios per element!
fancymenu.elements.audio.disable_vanilla:
You can disable the Vanilla music that plays in screens via FancyMenu's menu bar at the top of every screen, while you're NOT in the editor.

To toggle it off, disable: 
§zCustomization -> Settings -> Play Vanilla Menu Music
fancymenu.elements.audio.manage_audios.r: Do you really want to §xremove§r the selected audio track?
fancymenu.elements.audio.manage_audios.w: Weight above 1.0: Track is more likely to be selected
Weight below 1.0: Track is less likely to be selected
Weight 0.0: Track will never be selected in shuffle mode

Track weights affect how likely each track is to be selected in shuffle mode.
Default weight is 1.0. Range is 0.0 to 5.0.
fancymenu.elements.browser.desc: A browser where you can load a URL (website) in.
fancymenu.elements.browser.disabled_in_e: The browser is not interactive while in the editor!
fancymenu.elements.browser.hide_video_co:
If the controls of all videos should be hidden.
This will probably not work in some cases.
If the user should be able ot interact with the browser.
fancymenu.elements.browser.loop_videos.d:
If all videos should loop.
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.mcef_not_load: You need to install MCEF (mod) to use this element!
Set the base volume of media elements like audios and videos.
Should be a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.mute_media.de:
If all audios and videos should get muted on load.
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.url.desc: The URL the browser should load.
fancymenu.elements.button.active_state_c:
Control when/if the widget should be enabled (clickable)
or disabled (not clickable and greyed out).
fancymenu.elements.button.manage_actions:
Manage the actions this button
should execute when clicked.
fancymenu.elements.button.template_setti:
When you enable the template mode for a custom button, it will apply
some of its settings to all other buttons or sliders in the current screen.

Template buttons will be §linvisible§r outside the editor.

When you set the template to share settings with sliders, the
settings for the button textures will change to slider texture settings.

§lSettings that get shared are:

- Button/Slider Textures
- Button Click Sounds
- Button/Slider Hover Sounds
- Button/Slider Position (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Size (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Opacity (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Visibility (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Label (if enabled)
fancymenu.elements.button.tooltip.desc:
Tooltip to display when the widget is getting hovered.
If you need more control over the tooltip's design, use a dedicated Tooltip element.
fancymenu.elements.buttons.buttonbackgro:
The highlighted background is used
when focusing the slider by using the
arrow/tab key navigation in screens.
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.background_t: The hover background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
The inactive background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
The normal background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.checkmark_te:
The texture displayed when the checkbox is checked.
Leave empty to use the default checkmark.

The default checkmark texture is 20x20 pixels.
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.desc:
A clickable checkbox that can execute actions when toggled.

Use the '$$value' placeholder in its actions and loading requirements
to get the current checkbox state (true/false).
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.editor.set_v:
Link this checkbox to a variable.
Use the variable name.

The variable can be a new
or an existing variable.
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.manage_actio:
Actions will be executed when the checkbox is toggled.

You can use the '$$value' placeholder in actions
to get the current checkbox state (true/false).
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.variable_mod:
When enabled, this checkbox syncs its state with a FancyMenu variable.
It writes true/false to the linked variable when toggled.
fancymenu.elements.copyid.desc:
Copy the ID of this element, to use
it in loading requirements, etc.
fancymenu.elements.cursor.cursor_texture:
Make sure the texture is a PNG RGBA image
and is not too large.
32x32 or 64x64 pixel should be enough.
fancymenu.elements.cursor.desc:
A custom cursor that gets show
instead of the default one.

It's possible that the cursor behaviour
varies between operating systems.
fancymenu.elements.cursor.editor_preview:
Shows the custom cursor in the editor
when hovering over the cursor element.
fancymenu.elements.cursor.hotspot_x.desc:
The hotspot of a cursor is the
pixel of the cursor texture where
clicks get registered.
For a normal arrow cursor, this
would be the tip of the arrow.

The X0 Y0 coordinate of a texture
is at its top-left corner.
fancymenu.elements.cursor.hotspot_y.desc:
The hotspot of a cursor is the
pixel of the cursor texture where
clicks get registered.
For a normal arrow cursor, this
would be the tip of the arrow.

The X0 Y0 coordinate of a texture
is at its top-left corner.
fancymenu.elements.deprecated_warning.li: DEPRECATED ELEMENT! This element type gets removed in the future!
There should be a new version of this element type.
You should replace this element with the new version.
fancymenu.elements.dragger.desc:
The Dragger allows you to make parts of your layout dragable,
which means users can "grab" parts of layouts with
the mouse cursor and move them around.
fancymenu.elements.dragger.save_offset.d:
If the drag offset should be persistent
or reset every time the menu gets reopened.
fancymenu.elements.element.load_once_per:
Enabling this will make the element only load once per game session.
It stays active/visible until the user opens a new screen.
The 'game session' ends when restarting the game.
fancymenu.elements.element.stay_on_scree:
Will prevent the element from going
out of the visible screen area
when resizing the window or changing
the GUI scale.
§xYou need to disable 'Sticky Anchor' first to use this!
fancymenu.elements.features.advanced_pos:
§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

Allows you to manually set the
position of the element.

Advanced positions support placeholders,
so you can calculate positions
by using the Calculator placeholder,
get positions of other elements
and much more.

Many useful placeholders for element
positioning can be found
in the "GUI" and "Advanced"
placeholder categories.

§xYou will not be able to resize or
§xdrag and move the element while this
§xfeature is in use.
fancymenu.elements.features.advanced_siz:
§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

Allows you to manually set the
size of the element.

Advanced sizes support placeholders,
so you can calculate sizes
by using the Calculator placeholder,
get sizes of other elements
and much more.

Many useful placeholders for element
sizing can be found
in the "GUI" and "Advanced"
placeholder categories.

§xYou will not be able to resize
§xthe element on axes that got
§xoverridden by an advanced size.
fancymenu.elements.image.desc:
A simple image.
Supports local and web sources.
fancymenu.elements.image.restart_animate: Restart Animated Textures When Opening Screen: %s
fancymenu.elements.in_editor_color.desc: Set a custom in-editor color to help with organization.
fancymenu.elements.in_editor_display_nam:
The in-editor display name helps with organization.
It is shown in the layers widget and when
you pick an element using the right-click menu.
fancymenu.elements.input_field.desc:
A text input field.

Can be used to set variable
values by user input.
fancymenu.elements.input_field.editor.se:
Set the type of this text field.

The type defines what characters
the user can use in the field.

For example:
If the field is
set to "Only Numbers", the
user will only be able to
type numbers into the field.

Link this text field to a variable.
Use the variable name.

The variable can be a new
or an existing variable.
fancymenu.elements.item.desc:
An item like a sword, apple or grass block.
For the extra bit of battle pass menu flair!
fancymenu.elements.item.key.desc:
The registry key of the item.
Used to identify the item you want to display.
fancymenu.elements.item.lore.desc:
Set the lore of the item.
This input supports multiline and you
can even use 'Minecraft Text Components'.
Use one component (JSON) per line.

To learn more about text components, check this:
https://docs.fancymenu.net/en/text-formatting
fancymenu.elements.item.name: Item Name
fancymenu.elements.item.nbt.desc:
This allows you to set custom NBT data to the item.
It is basically the part the /give command that follows
after the item name in curly brackets {}.

§lFull example command:
/give @a netherite_sword{display:{Name:'["",{"text":"Kinabra","italic":false}]'}}

§lSet this as value for NBT:
{display:{Name:'["",{"text":"Kinabra","italic":false}]'}}

There are lots of Give Command Generators available online,
so just ask Google about it and you will find something.
fancymenu.elements.multiselect.loading_r:
§x§lOverride Loading Requirements?

The selected elements have different loading requirements!
All of their loading requirements will get §xoverridden§r!

Continue?
fancymenu.elements.music_controller.desc:
Element to control Vanilla music that plays in menus.

This element can't control music that plays
in worlds while no screen is open.
It is only to control music while a screen is open.
fancymenu.elements.music_controller.play:
This type of music plays in menus when NO world is loaded,
like in the Title screen for example.

This type of music plays in menus when a world is loaded.
It's basically the normal world music that
keeps playing in menus that don't pause the game,
like the inventory in SP and every menu in MP.
fancymenu.elements.parallax.desc:
If a parallax effect should get added to the element's position.

The parallax effect only works while not in the editor!
The horizontal intensity of the parallax effect.
This should be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement).
The vertical intensity of the parallax effect.
This should be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement).
fancymenu.elements.parallax.invert.desc:
When ENABLED, the element will move WITH the mouse.
When disabled, it will move in the opposite direction of the mouse.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.baby.de: If the player should be a baby.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.body_mo: If the player's pose should be animated.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.cape.au:
§xYou can't do this while
§x"Auto Cape" is enabled.

Tries to automatically pick
the cape based on the
element's player name.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.copy_cl:
§xYou can't do this while
§x"Copy Client Player" is enabled.

Automatically make the entity look
like the client player.

Copies the name, skin and cape.
If the player should have a parrot
on their shoulder.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.parrot_:
If the player's shoulder parrot
should be on the left shoulder.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.scale.d:
Set the entity's scale.

Default scale is 30.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.set_pla:
Set the player's name.

You can use any name here,
it doesn't have to be an
existing user.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.show_na: If the player name should be visible.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.skin.au:
§xYou can't do this while
§x"Auto Skin" is enabled.

Tries to automatically pick
the skin based on the
element's player name.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.slim.de: If the skin should be slim.
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.backgrou:
The background color is used in case there
is no background texture defined for the element.

If a background texture is defined,
the background color will be ignored.
Background Texture Nine-Slice Bottom Border Size [Pixels]
Background Texture Nine-Slice Left Border Size [Pixels]
Background Texture Nine-Slice Right Border Size [Pixels]
Background Texture Nine-Slice Top Border Size [Pixels]
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.bar_colo:
The bar color is used in case there
is no bar texture defined for the element.
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.bar_text:
If a bar texture is defined,
the bar color will be ignored.
Bar Texture Nine-Slice Bottom Border Size [Pixels]
Bar Texture Nine-Slice Left Border Size [Pixels]
Bar Texture Nine-Slice Right Border Size [Pixels]
Bar Texture Nine-Slice Top Border Size [Pixels]
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.desc:
A customizable progress bar which
supports setting a custom text source
for the current progress.
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.progress:
Use the current progress of this progress bar
as anchor origin position when using
this element as Element anchor.
That way other elements move with
the progress of the progress bar.
fancymenu.elements.progress_bar.source.d:
The progress source is the current progress
as percentage number between 0 and 100 or
floating point number between 0.0 and 1.0,
depending on the progress value mode.
The source supports placeholders, so there's
nothing that holds you from getting creative!
fancymenu.elements.shape.color.desc:
Set the HEX color of the shape.
Supports alpha channel (RGBA)!
fancymenu.elements.shape.rectangle.desc:
A rectangular shape.
Supports custom HEX RGBA colors.
fancymenu.elements.slider.desc:
A slider button.

Can be used to set variable
values by user input.
fancymenu.elements.slider.editor.list.se:
Set text values for the list slider.
§xOne value per text line.
fancymenu.elements.slider.editor.set_lab:
The prefix of the slider label.

The base of the slider label
is always the current value.

The suffix of the slider label.

The base of the slider label
is always the current value.
fancymenu.elements.slider.editor.set_var:
Link this slider to a variable.
Use the variable name.

The variable can be a new
or an existing variable.
fancymenu.elements.slider.editor.type.de:
Set the type of this slider.

When using the list type,
you can set a list of
text values and switch through
them when moving the slider.

The range type allows you
to switch through a range
of numbers.
You can set a min and a max value
when using this type.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.desc:
A slider button that can be used to
set variable values and more.
Executes actions on value change.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.label: Slider Label
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.label.desc:
The label of the slider.

To show the current slider value as part
of the label, use the §x$$value§r placeholder.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.manage_acti:
The actions this slider will execute
when its value gets changed.

You can get the slider's current value
by using the §x$$value§r placeholder in
action values or requirement values.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.pre_selecte:
This is the value that will be pre-selected
when the slider gets created, so make
sure this points to a variable or something
the slider sets.
If the slider sets a Minecraft option,
point this to the option value.
fancymenu.elements.slider.v2.type.list.s:
Set text values for the list slider.
One value per text line.
At least two values (lines) needed.
The decimal place to round the value to.
One (1) decimal place is one place
after the decimal point.

To not round the value, set it to §x-1§r.
The maximum value the range slider can reach.
The minimum value the range slider can reach.
fancymenu.elements.slideshow.desc:
A slideshow.
To learn more about slideshows,
visit docs.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.elements.splash.refresh.desc:
Pick a new splash everytime the screen
is getting reloaded or opened.
fancymenu.elements.text.base_color.desc:
Set the base color for the text.
Use HEX color codes.
fancymenu.elements.text.desc:
Add a text to render in
your layout.

Choose between local and online
sources for the text content.
The color used for every second row when 'Alternate Row Colors' is enabled.

The padding inside table cells.
Higher values create more space between content and cell borders.
Customize the appearance of Markdown tables.

The margin around tables.
Adds space above and below each table.
If the element should parse Markdown formatting codes.
fancymenu.elements.text.scroll_grabber_c:
The color of the grabber.
Use HEX color codes.
fancymenu.elements.text.set_source.direc: Set direct text content to render.
fancymenu.elements.text.set_source.local: Use a TXT file as content.
fancymenu.elements.text.set_source.web.d:
Get the plain web text content
of a website as text.
fancymenu.elements.text.source_mode.desc:
§zDirect Text:
Directly input a text to render.

§zLocal Source:
Use a TXT file as source.

§zWeb Source:
Use the plain text content
of a website as source.

§xChanging the source mode will
§xreset the text content!

§xYou can undo source changing
§xby pressing §lCTRL + Z§r§x!
fancymenu.elements.text.text_border.desc:
The text border is the space
between the text and the left
and right side of the element.
fancymenu.elements.text.v2.desc:
Renders a text body.
It support multi-line text, markdown
and has many options to customize
the look and feel of the element
and its content.
If this element should be interactable.
Disable this if you experience problems with
clicking elements above or under this text element.
fancymenu.elements.text.v2.source_mode.d:
§lDirect: §rInput text content via text editor.
§lResource: §rSet a source file to get the text content from.
fancymenu.elements.ticker.async.desc:
If the ticker should run in
a separate thread (asynchronous).
fancymenu.elements.ticker.desc:
Allows you to execute actions
every tick.

Supports asynchronous ticking
and tick delays.

Can be set to tick only once
every time you open the screen.

§xThis element is only visible
§xin the editor.
fancymenu.elements.ticker.manage_actions:
Manage the actions this ticker
should execute.
fancymenu.elements.ticker.tick_delay.des: Set the delay between ticks in milliseconds.
fancymenu.elements.ticker.tick_mode.desc:
§lNormal: §rTicker ticks every tick.

§lSession: §rTicker ticks once per game session.

§lOn Load Screen: §rTicker ticks once every time you load the screen.
Keep in mind that screens also get
reloaded when resizing the game window.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.background_te:
Set a custom background texture.
Uses nine-slicing to resize the texture for the current tooltip size.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.desc:
Renders a tooltip at a specific position or the mouse position.
Has full Markdown support, similar to Text elements.
Control its visibility with loading requirements.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.mouse_followi: If the tooltip should follow the mouse when outside the editor.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.nine_slice.de:
Here you can set settings related to the
nine-slicing logic of the custom tooltip background.
fancymenu.elements.vanilla_button.copy_l:
The widget locator points to a
specific widget in a specific screen.

§zThe widget locator is used for actions like 'Mimic Button'.
fancymenu.elements.vanilla_button.copyri: §cYou can't move the Copyright button out-of-screen!
fancymenu.elements.vanilla_button.draggi: §cTo move this element, change its anchor point first!
fancymenu.elements.video_mcef.desc:
A video player powered by MCEF.
§xThis element needs the MCEF mod to work!
fancymenu.elements.widgets.generic.navig:
If the user should be able to focus this
widget by using the Tab/Arrow key navigation.
fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.layoutoptions:
Add this layout to a group to randomly
pick one of the group's layouts
when opening the screen.

Can be used to randomize
backgrounds and other elements.

If layouts of this random group
should be random everytime the
screen gets opened or if only one layout
should be picked the first time
the screen gets opened.

Set the group of this layout.
One layout per group gets picked
when opening the screen.
fancymenu.game_intro.desc:
Plays an animated image or video before the
Title Screen is shown for the first time.
fancymenu.global_customizations.menu_mus: Remove all custom menu music tracks?
Replaces vanilla menu music with a custom randomized track list.
No custom menu music tracks configured.
Remove the selected track from the list?
§xYou can't edit the title of Custom GUIs.
§xTo edit Custom GUI titles, edit the GUI in
§xthe 'Manage Custom GUIs' screen.

Allows you to override the text at the
top of some screens with a custom one.

§xThis option might not work for some screens.

§xThe title needs to be at least 1 character long.
§xSpaces count as characters.
fancymenu.helper.editor.layoutoptions.ba:
Set an image, animation, panorama
or slideshow as background.
fancymenu.helper.editor.layoutoptions.un:
Add a screen to the blacklist
by its §lscreen identifier§r.

§xScreens on the blacklist will
§xbe ignored by the layout, so

elements are not too far apart
