fancymenu.requirements.world.has_player_:
If the player has absorption hearts.
Returns false when no world is loaded.

Returns TRUE when the current player has at least the specified permission level (0-4). Level 4 is the default level set via the OP command. Works in singleplayer worlds and multiplayer servers where permission data is available.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_any_effe:
If ANY effect is currently active.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_attack_s:
If the player's attack strength is currently not at 100%.
In Vanilla, this means the Attack Indicator is visible.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_clear_we:
If it's currently clear weather.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_difficul:
If the world has a certain difficulty.
Takes the name of a difficulty as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_effect_a:
If an effect is currently active.
Takes the key of an effect as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
[NO EFFECTS FOUND OR NOT IN A WORLD]
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_entity_n:
If an entity is nearby the player.
Takes the key of an entity and the check radius in blocks as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
[NO ENTITIES FOUND OR NOT IN A WORLD]
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_gamemode:
If the player is in a certain game mode.
Takes the name of a game mode as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_hotbar_s:
If a certain hotbar slot (0-8) is currently active/selected.
Takes the number of the target hotbar slot (0-8) as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_inventor:
If there's an item in a certain slot of the player's inventory.
This includes hotbar slots.
Takes the number of the target slot as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_left_han:
If the player is left-handed.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_player_c:
If the player is in Creative Fly mode.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_player_f:
If the player is flying with an elytra.
Returns false when no world is loaded.

If the player is fully frozen.
In Vanilla, this makes the health bar show as frozen hearts.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_player_i:
If the player is in a specific biome.
Takes the key of a biome as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
[NO BIOMES FOUND OR NOT IN A WORLD]

fancymenu.resources.chooser_screen.legac:
This is a non-asset local source!
Most features are disabled until you set a valid asset source!
To set an asset source, use the "Choose Resource" button.
fancymenu.resources.chooser_screen.no_ex:
The source has no valid file extension suffix!
This could mean you're using placeholders that dynamically build the source.
Make sure to only use file types from the "Allowed File Types" list!
fancymenu.resources.pre_loading.desc:
Set resources to pre-load on game start,
so they are ready to use once the game
loading process is completed.
fancymenu.resources.pre_loading.manage.r:
Remove Resource?

Do you really want to remove the selected resource?
fancymenu.resources.source_type.local.de:
This source type lets you load local resources
saved in Minecraft's instance directory.
You need to save all of FancyMenu's resources
to '/config/fancymenu/assets/'.
fancymenu.resources.source_type.location:
This source type uses Minecraft's own resource
system to get resources, so in other words,
it can use resources of resource packs,
Vanilla Minecraft and mods.

Here you need to input the resource location
of the resource you want to use.
Resource locations consist of two parts.
The first part is the namespace and the second
part is the path.
These two parts are separated by a colon (:).

To learn more about resource locations,
please visit resources.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.resources.source_type.web.desc:
This source type lets you use web resources via URL.
Resource URLs should ALWAYS be DIRECT URLs,
which means they should point directly to the
resource and end with the resource's name + extension.
URLs also need to start with http:// or https://.

§xUsing non-direct URLs will hurt the performance!
fancymenu.scroll_screen_normalizer: Expose Scroll Area Content Of Current Screen: %s
fancymenu.scroll_screen_normalizer.desc:
This will try to extract buttons and sliders from scroll areas
of the current screen, if it contains scroll areas.

This is useful to make, for example, options screens customizable.
The amount of time in milliseconds FancyMenu should cache
replaced text of placeholders to make them less performance-heavy.

Setting this to 0 will disable caching.

§x§lCaching can cause unexpected behaviour in complex setups and action scripts!
The amount of time in milliseconds FancyMenu should cache
the state of requirements to make them less performance-heavy.

Setting this to 0 will disable caching.

§x§lCaching can cause unexpected behaviour in complex setups and action scripts!

fancymenu.welcome.screen.headline: Thank you for using FancyMenu!

The Welcome screen will not show up again
after clicking this button.
You don't need to manually edit any config files.
fancymenu.welcome.screen.text:
Before you begin customizing with FancyMenu, please make sure to **read the documentation** thoroughly. While FancyMenu can seem overwhelming initially, the documentation will guide you step-by-step.

Start with the [Getting Started](https://docs.fancymenu.net) page for the basics of menu customization. Don’t forget to explore the other sections as they offer valuable insights and tips!

You can also join the official [Discord](https://discord.gg/rhayah27GC) if you have any questions!

**I hope you have a fantastic time with FancyMenu!**

fancymenu.actions.blocks.add.execute_lat:
Adds an Execute Later block that schedules its contained actions to run after the specified delay.

Delay time is in milliseconds.

Every time the script reaches this block, it schedules a new execution on the main thread.

This is useful for delayed actions in scripts that only run once.

fancymenu.schedulers.manage.desc:
Schedulers let you execute action scripts on a timed basis.
They can run in the background, even when no screen is open.
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.cancel_warni:
Do you really want to cancel?
§xThis will undo everything you've done in here!
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.delete_warni:
Do you really want to §xdelete§r the selected scheduler?
§xThis action cannot be undone!
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.rename_tip: Rename schedulers by double-clicking their ID.
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.quick_edit_t: Right-click schedulers to quick-edit their actions.
fancymenu.schedulers.settings.title: Scheduler Settings
fancymenu.schedulers.settings.id.desc: Unique identifier used by the Start Scheduler action.
fancymenu.schedulers.settings.start_dela: Delay before the first tick runs in milliseconds.
fancymenu.schedulers.settings.tick_delay:
Delay between ticks in milliseconds.
Use 0 to tick every 50ms (~20x per second).
If the client lags, multiple ticks can queue for the same client tick.
fancymenu.schedulers.settings.ticks_to_r:
How many ticks the scheduler should run.
Use 0 for permanent.
fancymenu.actions.start_scheduler.desc: Starts a scheduler by its unique identifier.
fancymenu.actions.stop_scheduler.desc: Stops a scheduler by its unique identifier.
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.start_now.de:
Start the selected scheduler immediately.
Schedulers cannot be started again until they finish.
fancymenu.schedulers.manage.stop_now.des:
Stop the selected scheduler immediately.
Schedulers cannot be started again until they finish.
fancymenu.requirements.is_scheduler_runn: Checks whether a scheduler with the given identifier is currently running.
fancymenu.actions.spawn_element_instance:
Spawns a new element instance by deserializing an element body and injecting it into the active customization layer.
Spawned elements are not saved and disappear when the screen or layout reloads.

The element type to spawn.
Changing this will reset the body to a default preset for the selected type.

The identifier assigned to the spawned element.
Leave blank to auto-generate one.
Placeholders are supported.

The serialized element body (single element container).
Paste the element block from a layout file if needed.
Placeholders are supported.
If disabled, placeholders inside the element body are not replaced before deserialization.
No element types are currently available.
fancymenu.listeners.on_element_spawned.d:
This listener triggers when an element instance is spawned via the 'Spawn Element Instance' action.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$element_type §r= The spawned element type identifier
- §z$$element_identifier §r= The spawned element's identifier
- §z$$target_screen §r= The target screen identifier
